12000 BC - 10900 BC: Hunter/Gatherer Agriculture
holocene_event.para: The first agriculture or selection of plants for food to carry started with wild grains as the groups moved across the landscape.

This ended with the Colvis Impact. The Younger Dryus pushed the growing zones for grain more southward. Starvation and the abandonment of settlements as the people moved around to find food. Their movement and attempts to find grain caused them to try to grow it where conditions seemed right creating true agriculture.

holocene_event.title: 9500 BC: The eight Neolithic founder crops
holocene_event.para: The crops were the first to be domesticated: emmer and einkorn wheat, hulled barley, peas, lentils, bitter vetch, chick peas and flax. The first cultivation was in the Levant.
